result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Odell Gatlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Joshua Odell Gatlin was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Odell Gatlin is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Joshua Odell Gatlin was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge (if not already done so) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds.
- Restitution set at $0 (zero).

superMiscConds.notes: - NO CONTACT ORDER with the victim.

- Sex Offender Evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy.
- Maintain compliance with the Sex Offender Registry throughout defendant's Lifetime.
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes: COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua Odell Gatlin in court, in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.\
Prior to commencement of the hearing defendant files 2 documents; statements by the State in reply.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State and defendant. 

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

-  Court sets Restitution at $0  (zero) 

As to Count  1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  17  years with  168   days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -   7  years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  10  years.  

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-  Sex Offender evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Seek/Maintain full-time employment
-  No Contact Order with the victim
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge (if not already done so) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds
-  Maintain compliance with the Sex Offender Registry throughout defendant's lifetime

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Clerk:  jms

Brady Material Demand 
Motion New Trial

- filed by defendant - received

Per Order dated June 15, 2022, Appeal No 22AP691-W, 
IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee. This order
waives only the filing fees in the Court of Appeals. It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose.
Indigency may be reevaluated if a request is received for waiver of other fees based on indigency.

Court trial exhibits from July 6th, 7th, 11th and 12th, 2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 788.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua Odell Gatlin, Pro Se, in court, in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Closing argument by the State; no argument by defendant.
Court makes credibility determinations and places findings of fact on the record.

As to Count 1:  Court finds defendant guilty as to Count 1 and orders judgment of conviction be entered into the record.

As to Count 2:  Court finds defendant not guilty as to Count 2 and orders judgment of acquittal be entered into the record.

Neither party is requesting PSI.  PSI not ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
Defendant remanded pending sentencing.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant is challenging statements made to Detective Wells.

Court admits Exhibit # 16 as to the trial
Defendant's request that Court take judicial notice of the DNA State Crime Lab report
Exhibit # 13 - offered and received
Court holds colloquy with defendant and finds the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives his right to testify

Trial to continue on July 12, 2022

Defendant Joshua Odell Gatlin, Pro Se, in court, in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Discussion with the parties as to property control and what items were inventoried.
Defendant requests DNA testing; discussion with the parties.
Judge reviews the speedy trial demand request.
For reasons stated on the record Court finds good cause and will allow DNA evidence even though State did not provide notice with the 45 day time period.

Defendant requests a court trial; statements to the Court by the State.
Defendant signs waiver of jury trial
Court holds colloquy with defendant and finds defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives his right to a jury trial.
Court releases the jury panel from their service

10:49 a.m.  Back on the record

Court adjourns case for the lunch hour; trial to resume at 1:30 p.m.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Joshua Odell Gatlin, Pro Se, in court, in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Back on the record.

1:35 p.m.  Jury in the box
Voir dire commences and jurors sworn as to their qualifications
3:05 p.m.  Jury out of the box
Strikes for cause
3:29 p.m.  Jury in the box
3:39 p.m.  Jury out of the box
Court places on the record that defendant took all of defense strikes for cause at one time; juror list was not passed back and forth between the defense and the State.  Discussion with the parties.  State does not object.
3:45 p.m.  Jury in the box
At the hour of 3:49 p.m. the parties impanel 13 good and lawful citizens of Milwaukee County.
3:51 p.m.  Jurors not selected for the panel excused and out of the box
3:52 p.m.  Jury out of the box
Discussion with the parties regarding portions of the video to be played for the jury
4:23 p.m.  Jury in the box
Jurors sworn to try the issue.
Court gives preliminary instructions.
Court adjourns case for the evening; trial to continue on July 6, 2022.
4:41 p.m.  Jury out of the box.

Clerk:  jms

Jury in the box at 11:58 a.m.
Court gives preliminary opening statements to the panel.  Court will adjourn for the lunch hour.  Case adjourned to 1:30 p.m.
Jury out of the box at 12:02 p.m.

Defendant Joshua Odell Gatlin in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Joshua Odell Gatlin in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defense Motion to Withdraw heard.  Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel.  Upon questioning, the Court finds the defendant competent to proceed and knowingly and voluntarily waives right to counsel.  Court will allow attorney Tom Harris to withdraw as counsel on this case.  Attorney Harris handed paper copies of discovery case to defendant.  Defendant to be produced for next court date.  All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:08 AM Defendant Joshua Odell Gatlin in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Defendant Joshua Odell Gatlin in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective S. Wells. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring -  No contact order only. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AP and Milwaukee Excellence High School.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joshua Odell Gatlin in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Joshua Odell Gatlin in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
